me.recsfor.app

Class CredentialEncryption

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.recsfor.app.CredentialEncryption

  • public class CredentialEncryption
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to encrypt user credentials (their password), so they can be securely stored in a database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CredentialEncryption() 
      CredentialEncryption(java.lang.String pass)
      Constructor to create a hash for the provided password using a newly generated salt.
      CredentialEncryption(java.lang.String pass, java.lang.String salt)
      Constructor to create a hash for the provided password using a previously generated salt.

      Instance method to determine whether a password matches its stored hash, using the generated salt for the user.

      Static method to determine whether a password matches its stored hash, using the generated salt for the user.

      • CredentialEncryption

        public CredentialEncryption()

      • CredentialEncryption

        public CredentialEncryption(java.lang.String pass)
                     throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                            java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                            org.apache.commons.codec.DecoderException
        Constructor to create a hash for the provided password using a newly generated salt.
        Parameters:
        pass - the password to hash
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the encryption can not be applied
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is wrong
        org.apache.commons.codec.DecoderException - if a hex string can not be converted

      • CredentialEncryption

        public CredentialEncryption(java.lang.String pass,
                            java.lang.String salt)
                     throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                            java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                            org.apache.commons.codec.DecoderException
        Constructor to create a hash for the provided password using a previously generated salt.
        Parameters:
        pass - the password to hash
        salt - the salt to use
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the encryption can not be applied
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is wrong
        org.apache.commons.codec.DecoderException - if the salt can not be converted

      • validatePassword

        public static boolean validatePassword(java.lang.String testPass,
                                       java.lang.String storedHash,
                                       java.lang.String storedSalt)
                                throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                       java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                       org.apache.commons.codec.DecoderException
        Static method to determine whether a password matches its stored hash, using the generated salt for the user.
        Parameters:
        testPass - the password to check
        storedHash - the known correct password hash
        storedSalt - the user's salt
        Returns:
        whether or not the password is correct
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the test password can not be encrypted
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is wrong
        org.apache.commons.codec.DecoderException - if the hashes can not be converted

      • validatePassword

        public boolean validatePassword(java.lang.String storedHash)
                         throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                org.apache.commons.codec.DecoderException
        Instance method to determine whether a password matches its stored hash, using the generated salt for the user.
        Parameters:
        storedHash - the known correct password hash
        Returns:
        whether or not the password is correct
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the test password can not be encrypted
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is wrong
        org.apache.commons.codec.DecoderException - if the hashes can not be converted
